thread.title: Man wanted over death of four-year-old girl in hit-and-run 'fled country within hours'
thread.title_full: Man wanted over death of four-year-old girl in hit-and-run 'fled country within hours'

author: Connor Dunn
title: Man wanted over death of four-year-old girl in hit-and-run 'fled country within hours'
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A man suspected of being involved in four-year-old Violet Grace Youens' death "fled the country within hours" of the hit and run, police say. 
The man seen wearing blue and running from the crash left about three hours after the incident on Friday. 
Detectives say it sums up the kind of person this suspect is. 
He is now the third man believed to be involved in the incident on Friday after noon which Violet-Grace dead and her nan, Angela French, 55, in hospital. Violet Grace Youens was hit by a stolen car in St Helens, Merseyside on Friday but died in her mums arms late on Saturday (Photo: Mercury Press & Media) CCTV of the two suspects wanted over the death of four-year-old Violet Grace Youens (Photo: Enterprise News and Pictures) 
Revealing new information on the case, St Helens Police Chief Inspector Chris Sephton told the Liverpool Echo : “A 23-year-old man has fled the country. He left approximately three hours after the incident. 
“That gives you the measure of the type of man he is. 
“A girl critically ill in hospital at the time, a nan still critically ill in hospital, the devastation at the scene and a family trying to come to terms with what has happened and this individual flees the country. 
“That tells you all that you need to know.” Violet-Grace tragically died in mum's arms on Mother's Day (Photo: Gofundme) Tributes laid at the site of the hit and run in Merseyside (Photo: Mercury Press & Media) 
Detectives, have today arrested a man, 27, on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. 
Officers say that a third man, a 23-year-old man who was arrested earlier today, was “not in the car at the time of the crash” and has been released pending further enquires. 
Violet-Grace and her nan were reportedly struck by a black Ford Fiesta, believed to be stolen, as they crossed Prescot Road on Friday afternoon. 
Angela French is currently in a “serious but stable condition”. Police at the scene of the incident in St Helens, Merseyside (Photo: Mercury Press & Media) Chief Inspector Chris Sephton said a man fled the country three hours after the incident (Photo: Liverpool Echo WS) 
Inspector Sephton added: “From the stills that have been circulated it is the man wearing the blue who is still outstanding. 
“We have been in contact with the authorities of the country where we believe he is. We are not releasing that information at the present time. 
“We are doing everything we can to try and identify where he is now and get him back over here.” 
If you can give police any information which could assist with their investigation contact 0151 777 6041 or the Crimestoppers line, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
